author: Anonymous Scale
title: Map vs Foldr
question:
Hello,
For the foldr function, we are required to provide a base case to the function, however for map we do not have to. They both operate on lists (although foldr is adding creating a list) but why do we not have to provide a base case for map? How does it know it has finished it's recursion?
student_answer:
The base case for the map is empty, as it produces a list. It will always be empty.
The foldr function outputs an arbitrary data type, which is why the base case must be defined.
